main event: An unidentified object was observed in Spokane, Washington on March 3, 1956.
interesting points: The object was detected on radar as a blimp and moved rapidly before fading., Two other similar objects were indicated on the radar., The pilot speculated that the object could be a civilian R-500 series fighter aircraft., Witnesses reported seeing a bright bluish-white light hovering before it accelerated quickly and disappeared., The object was estimated to be 25 to 30 feet in diameter and at an altitude of approximately 2,500 to 3,000 feet.
witness description: Witnesses included civilians who were observing the sky for a comet.
